results.title: La Carriere de Suzanne = Suzanne's Career
results.brief_description:
This early installment of the ‘Six Moral Tales ‘series revolves around the rather free-floating amourous life of a young student in the Latin Quarter in the 1960s. ‘La Carriere de Suzanne’ is not typical of the other ‘Contes Moraux’ involving four young people in game playing during the course of failed relationships. In this film the theme is both more complex and less clear than in the first moral tale.

Credits: Producer, Barbet Schroeder ; director, writer, editor, Eric Rohmer ; photography, Daniel Lacambre.
Cast: Catherine See, Philippe Beuzen, Christian Charriere.

results.title: La Cage aux Folles II
results.creator_credit: Edouard Molinaro, Marcello Danon, Paris Da Ma Produzione and Productions Artistes Associes
results.brief_description: Comic sequel to the phenomenally popular French farce about aging gay couple Renato and Albin—the proprietor and main attraction of a Riviera drag cabaret. This time Renato’s suggestion that Albo is a bit too mature to impersonate a young Marlene Dietrich sets off a series of madcap adventures. When Albin, dressed in drag, is picked up by a spy escaping enemy agents, the couple unwittingly find themselves innocent victims of a murderous espionage ring and are forced to flee, escaping to Italy in an mishap packed cross country journey to hide out on Renato’s family’s farm. The hilarity continues as Albin finds that his attractiveness has not diminished after all, when he becomes an object of lust for a group of lonely farmhands. The comic talents of Michel Serrault, and the chemistry between him and Ugo Tognazzi are a highlight of the film. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: La Cage aux Folles 3: the wedding
results.creator_credit: Georges Lautner, Marcello Danon, Da Ma Produzione and Columbia Films
results.brief_description: Third and final installment of the “La Cage aux Folles” comedies begins with the St. Tropez nightclub of the title in serious financial trouble. When club owner Renato learns that his lover and the club’s star drag artiste Albin, is about to inherit a vast fortune from a distant relative, he thinks his problems are solved. But the gay couple’s long running relationship is thrown into chaos when they find out there are strings attached. Albin must marry and produce a heir within eighteen months or the whole inheritance will be forfeited. Despite consultations with marriage brokers and all the best intentions, it seems nothing will assist Albin reach his reward - until help arrives in an unlikely form. Cast includes Ugo Tognazzi, Marcel Bozzuffi, Michel Galabru and Antonella Interlenghi. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: La Cage Aux Folles [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Edouard Molinaro, Marcello Danon, Da Ma Produzione and Productions Artistes Associes
results.brief_description: La Cage aux Folles is the name of a transvestite nightclub run by a pair of aging homosexuals, one of whom has a son eager to be married. However his fiancee’s father is the chief of a political party dedicated to morality who is not likely to approve of his new in-laws. A touching and sensitive comedy that proves love has no boundaries. Based on the play by Jean Poiret. Screenplay by Francis Verber. Cast includes Michelle Serrault, Ugo Tognazzi and Michel Galabru. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: La Boheme: an opera in four scenes by Giacomo Puccini
results.creator_credit: Giancarlo Menotti and Valiant SRL Productions
results.brief_description: Giacomo Puccini’s opera in four scenes based on the novel “Scenes de la vie de Boheme” by Henri Murger with libretto by G. Giacosa and L. Illica. This made for television production of “La Boheme” is performed by the Orchestra and Chorus of The Municipal Opera Theatre of Genoa and conducted by Leone Magiera along with Choir master Dante Ghersi. “La Boheme” is a tragic love story played out in the Latin Quarter of 1830s Paris where poet, Rodolfo (Luciano Pavarotti) and painter, Marcello (Roberto Servile) live in poverty with their loves Mimi (Fiamma Izzo D’amico) and Musetta (Madelyn Renee). Rodolfo’s love for Mimi is a passionate and consuming affair which almost destroys their relationship. However love survives even in the face of hopelessness and despair. The spirit of the young Bohemian students, their gaiety and pathos masking the ensuing pain, is captured beautifully. Excellent performances by the lead singers supported by a complimentary cast including Jeffrey Mattsey, Francesco Ellero d’Artegna, Roberto Scaltriti, Guido Pasella.

results.title: La Boheme by Giacomo Puccini
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Nottage and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This opera in four acts was first performed at Turin on February 1, 1896. Music is by Giacomo Puccini, Libretto by Giuseppe Giacosa and Luigi Illica, after Henry Murger’s novel “Scenes de la vie de Boheme”. Recorded live at the Sydney Opera House, February 25, 1993. This performance stars Cheryl Baker as Mimi, David Hobson as Rodolfo, Roger Lemke as Marcello and Christine Douglas as Musetta; the four star-crossed lovers. Stage direction by Baz Luhrmann. Music performed by the Australian Opera and Ballet Orchestra and conducted by Julian Smith. In Paris in 1830, two young, free-spirited artists, Rodolfo and Marcello, live in poverty with their loves Mimi and Musetta. A story of passionate love and unbreakable hope in the face of despair. The spirit of youth, its gaiety and pathos is captured beautifully. The opera makes its effect atmospherically in scenes, like a series of impressionist paintings, not by the usual developing dramatic action. The scenery is minimal and captures the brevity of the lives of the characters and contrasts the extreme gravity of their situation.

results.title: La Boheme
results.brief_description: Filmed in 1967 at the Teatro alla Scala, Milan, Puccini’s opera is performed here with Mirella Freni (Mimi) and the chorus and orchestra of the Teatro alla Scala. It is set in the students’ quarter of Paris, where gaiety and pathos rub elbows. The opera is seen to laugh as well as weep. It achieves balance between the gay and the pathetic, the realistic and the impressionistic, due to its solid theatrical foundations. Designed and directed by Franco Zeffirelli.

results.title: La Boheme
results.brief_description: The Australian Opera Company presents another outstanding production of Puccini’s famous opera “La Boheme” which was recorded in 1988 and features the voices of Glenys Fowles, Neil Rosenshein, Rosamund Illing and John Fulford. The Elizabethan Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted by Carlo Felice Cillario performs the music for the company. An Emmy Award winning production.

results.title: La Boheme
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, John Copley, Covent Garden Video Productions and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: This made for television production of Giacomo Puccini’s “La Boheme” with libretto by Guiseppe Giacosa and Luigi Illica after the novel by Henri Murger was performed at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden on 16 February 1982. It features the Royal Opera Chorus (Chorus master John McCarthy) and The Orchestra of the Royal Opera House conducted by Lamberto Gardelli with music direction for The Royal Opera by Sir Colin Davis. “La Boheme” is essentially a tale of doomed love, set in the Bohemian quarters of 1830s Paris. The roles of the two lovers, Mimi and Rodolfo, are sung by Ileana Cotrubas and Neil Shicoff along with Marilyn Zschau as Musetta and Thomas Allen as Marcello. Supporting cast includes Gwynne Howell, John Rawnsley, Brian Donlan. Sung in Italian with no English subtitles. Includes a booklet guide.
